intro: Tinnea linearifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf tinnea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
